recipe_long_name: Sabudana Pakoras recipe - How to make Sabudana Pakoras
recipe_ing:
2 cups sago (sabudana)
 2 cups rice flour (chawal ka atta)
 3 cups  (sour) buttermilk
 2 tsp chilli powder or
 6 green chillies (cut into small pieces)
 2 tsp salt
 2  big onions, chopped (optional)
 oil to fry
recipe:
Wash sabudana.
Soak it in the sour butter milk for 1hr.
Add rice flour.
Add chilli powder.
Don't add water.
Add salt to taste.
Add finely chopped onions.
Keep oil to fry.
Don't knead the dough smoothly.
When the oil is ready take small lumps and put in the oil and deep fry.
tags:
Gujarati  Faral, Faraal
Deep-fried Indian Starters
Deep Fry
Mahashivaratri
Navratri Vrat
times: Preparation Time: 20 minutes, Cooking Time: 15 minutes, Total Time: 35 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Sabudana Pakoda recipe - How to make Sabudana Pakoda
recipe_ing:
1 cup sago (sabudana)
 1 cup curds (dahi)
 3 to 4 onions, chopped
 2 tsp green chilli paste
 salt to taste
 1/2 cup rice flour (chawal ka atta)
 coriander (dhania) leaves
 oil for deep frying
recipe:
Soak sabudana in dhai for 2hrs.
Then add green chill paste,onions,rice flour,salt,and hara dhania and make a paste.
Then take a pan and oil in that,heat it.
Pakode ke tharah deep fry till golden brown,
Serve with green chuteny or tomato sause.
Yummy chrisp sabudana pakodas ready to eat.
tags:
Gujarati  Faral, Faraal
Maharashtrian Upvas (Fasting)
Deep Fry
Mahashivaratri
Navratri Vrat
times: Preparation Time: 10min, Cooking Time: 10min, Total Time: 20 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Chat (khakra) recipe - How to make Chat (khakra)
recipe_ing:
12 to 15 cups khakhras
 1/4 cup chopped onions
 1 tsp grated garlic (lehsun)
 4 blanched and pureed tomatoes
 1/4 cup paneer (cottagte cheese) cubes
 1/4 cup boiled sweet corn kernels (makai ke dane)
 1/4 cup boiled green peas
 1 chopped tomato
 1 sliced red chilli
 1 tsp sugar
 1 tsp chilli powder
 1 tsp dried oregano
 2 tbsp oil
 salt to taste
 For The Garnish:
 2 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
recipe:
Method
Heat the oil in a pan, add the onions and garlic and sauté till the onion turns translucent.
Add the puréed tomatoes and cook till the oil separates.
Add the paneer, sweet corn, green peas, tomato, red chilli, sugar, chilli powder, oregano and salt and sauté for 2 to 3 minutes.
Remove from the flame and keep aside.
How to proceed
Place the broken khakra pieces on a serving plate.
Top with the tomato chutney and garnish with the chopped coriander.
Serve immediately.
tags:
Gujarati  Dry Snacks
Chaat
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 15 mins, Total Time: 25 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Cucumber Raita recipe - How to make Cucumber Raita
recipe_ing:
2 grated cucumber
 2 cups beaten low fat curds
 salt to taste
 1 tsp green chilli paste
 a pinch powdered sugar
 1 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson) powder
recipe:
Method
Drain the excess water from cucumber by squeezing with your palms.
Combine the cucumber along with all the other ingredients in a bowl and mix well.
Refrigerate for 2 to 3 hours.
Serve chilled.
tags: Gujarati Kachumber / Chutneys / Achar
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 0 mins , Total Time: 10 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Green Tomato Chutney recipe - How to make Green Tomato Chutney
recipe_ing:
5 chopped green tomatoes
 200 ml vinegar
 300 gms sugar
 salt to taste
 1/8 tsp black salt (sanchal)
 1 tsp roasted and crushed cumin seeds (jeera)
 1/2 cup chopped onions
 1 tsp chilli powder
recipe:
Method
Combine all the ingredients in a deep pan and cook on a medium flame till it reduce to half, keep stirring in between while cooking.
Remove from the flame when it turns thick.
Serve hot or chill.
tags: Gujarati Kachumber / Chutneys / Achar
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 15 mins, Total Time: 25 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Faraali Sanwa Khichdi recipe - How to make Faraali Sanwa Khichdi
recipe_ing:
1 cup sama millet ,  washed
 2 tbsp ghee
 1 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1 small potato , cubed
 2 tsp rock salt
 1/2 tsp chilli powder
 2 small green chillies
 chopped coriander (dhania) for garnishing
recipe:
Method
Heat the ghee in a pressure cooker and add the cumin seeds and green chillies.
When the seeds crackle, add the chilli powder and salt and saute for 10 seconds.
Add the potato and rice, mix well and saute till they turn golden brown.
Add 2 cups water,lower the flame and cover and pressure cook for about 5-6 minutes or till the potatoes are cooked and water is dried.
Serve hot garnished with coriander.
tags: Gujarati Khichdi
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 10 mins, Total Time: 25 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Khamani recipe - How to make Khamani
recipe_ing:
1 cup besan (bengal gram flour)
 1 cup curds (dahi)
 salt to taste
 a pinch of turmeric powder (haldi)
 2 tsp oil
 1 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 a pinch of asafoetida (hing)
 For The Garnish:
 chopped coriander (dhania)
 freshly grated coconut
recipe:
Method
In a deep pan, combine enough water, curd, besan, salt and turmaric powder and whisk well.
Boil and simmer for 10-15 minutes, while stirring continiously.
Remove from the flame and grease the clean table top.
Pour the batter on the table top and spread it evenly.
Cool for 5 minutes and cut in to thin strips.
Gently lift and roll all the strips and arrange in a shallow box.
Heat the oil in a small pan and add the mustard seeds and cumin seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the asafoetida and pour this to the rolls.
Garnish with chopped coriender leaves and fresh greated coconut.
tags: Gujarati Farsans
times: Preparation Time: 20 mins, Cooking Time: 15 mins, Total Time: 35 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Suran na Dahi Wada recipe - How to make Suran na Dahi Wada
recipe_ing:
50 gms yam (suran)
 235 gms  sago flour
 100 gms mava (khoya)
 1 cup powdered peanuts
 salt to taste
 1 tsp black pepper (kalimirch) powder
 1 tsp ginger (adrak)
 1 tsp chopped green chillies
 2 tsp sugar
 grated coconut to garnish
 coriander (dhania) leaves to garnish
 curds (dahi)
recipe:
First pressure cook suran.
Then mash it.
Also blend the sago mixture without water.
Then heat 2 tablespoons of ghee and add 1tsp of jeera and when it starts changing its color add the mashed suran.
Cook the suran till it evaporates all its water and the mixture appears dry.
Switch off the gas.
Then add khoya,salt,sugar,black pepper,
Ginger and green chillies.
Then make small ball of this mixture.
Dip it in the sago flour.
Fry till light pink in color.
Then on a plate take these wadas and add dahi ti it. sprinkle coriander and coconut and sweet chutney and enjoy your fast.
tags: Gujarati  Faral, Faraal
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 20 mins, Total Time: 35 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Veg Dhokla recipe - How to make Veg Dhokla
recipe_ing:
2  katoris of green moong dal (split  green gram)
 2 green chillies
 1 tbsp oil
 a pinch of asafoetida (hing)
 salt to taste
recipe:
Soak the green moong dal for 4-5 hours in water.
Then take the moong dal and add very little of water and grind this toether with green chillies and hing and salt.
Then take a thali and grease it with oil.
Spread that moong dal batter on the greased thali.
Put this greased thali in a dhokla vessel or if u dont have that vessel then take a kadhai and boil water in it and put that thali on some support in the kadhai.
Cover the thali and cook till 12 mins or till a knife immersed in the panoli comes out to be clean.
Eat it with dahi.
tags:
Gujarati Farsans
Breakfast Dhokla
Indian Steamed Snacks
Steam
Steamer
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 10 mins, Total Time: 20 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Whole Moong Tikki recipe - How to make Whole Moong Tikki
recipe_ing:
1 cup whole moong (whole green gram),  soaked for 5 hours
 2 tbsp cornflour
 a pinch of asafoetida (hing)
 1 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1 tbsp ginger-green chilli paste
 1/4 cup chopped onions
 1 tsp garam masala
 1 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
 a pinch soda bi-carb
 4 curry leaves (kadi patta)
 salt to taste
 oil for deep frying
recipe:
Method
Drain and grind the moong without water or with minimum water to a smooth paste.
In a mixing bowl, Combine the grounded moong, corn flour, asafoetida, cumin seeds, ginger-chilli paste, onions, garam masala, coriander, curry leaves, soda bi-carb and salt, mix well and bind together to make a thick mixture.
Divide the mixture into equal portions and roll it into small balls and flatten it.
Heat the oil in a kadhai, and deep-fry the tikkis till it turns to golden brown in colour from both the sides.
Remove on absorbent paper. Repeat the same process to make more tikkis.
Serve immediately.
tags:
Gujarati Farsans
Deep Fry
Kadai Veg
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 20 mins, Total Time: 35 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Gujarati Kadhi (gujatathi Kadhi) recipe - How to make Gujarati Kadhi (gujatathi Kadhi)
recipe_ing:
2 tbsp besan (bengal gram flour)
 1 1/2 cups curds (dahi)
 1 tsp ginger-green chilli paste
 2 curry leaves (kadi patta)
 2 tbsp sugar  (approx.)
 2 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
 salt to taste
 For The Tempering:
 1/2 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1/2 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 a pinch asafoetida (hing)
 1 red chilli broken into pieces
 2 tsp ghee
recipe:
Method
Mix the gram flour, curds and 3 teacups of water. Beat.
Add the chilli-ginger paste, curry leaves, sugar and salt and put to boil.
Boil whilst stirring for a while.
Prepare the tempering by heating the ghee and frying the cumin and mustard seeds until they turn brown. Add the asafoetida and red chilli.
Add the tempering to the kadhi and boil for a few minutes.
Sprinkle coriander on top and serve hot.
tags:
Collection of Gujarati Dals / Kadhis
Kadhi recipes from all across India
Quick Dals / quick Kadhis
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 15 mins, Total Time: 25 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Potato Sheera recipe - How to make Potato Sheera
recipe_ing:
1/2 kilo boiled potatoes
1 cup milk
sugar as per taste (approx less than equal to smashed potatoes)
1 tea spoon elaichi powder
3 to 4 saffron strands
6 tbsp ghee
recipe:
Heat tawa, add ghee and when it gets hot, add finely shamshed potatoes and sugar and stir continuously. 
Fry the potatoes, add some milk in between and go on cooking on a medium to slow flame. 
When it turns to yellowish colour, add elaichi powder.
Add some saffron strands in milk, get it disolved and then add to the sheera.
tags:
Gujarati Sweet Mithai
 different kinds of sheera
Diwali
Raksha - Bandhan
Recipes for Weaning (8 to 9 months)
times: Preparation Time: half an hour, Cooking Time: half and hour, Total Time: 1 hours,

recipe_long_name: Sagoo Icecream recipe - How to make Sagoo Icecream
recipe_ing:
vanilla ice cream-1/2 lt
sagoo 1/2 cup 
whipping cream powder-1 sachet
1/2 cup cream
gelatin-3tsp
rose water-1tsp
recipe:
1.boil sagoo in 2cups water cook till done and drain ,cool and keep aside.
2.boil gelatin in 1cup water in a double boiler and cool.
3.mix all other ingredients in a blender and mix sagoo and gelatin andpour  in a pudding dish .if needed garnish with chopped nuts.chill until set.
tags:
Gujarati  Faral, Faraal
Indian  Ice Creams
Indian Freezer
times: Preparation Time: 30min, Cooking Time: 15min, Total Time: 45 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Mix Vegetable Khichdi recipe - How to make Mix Vegetable Khichdi
recipe_ing:
2 cups soaked long grained rice (basmati)
 3 cups yellow moong dal (split yellow gram) , soaked
 2 potatoes , chopped
 1/4 cup green peas
 1 carrot , chopped
 3 green chillies , chopped
 2 spring onions , chopped
 1 tsp grated ginger (adrak)
 2 garlic (lehsun) cloves , chopped
 4 to 5 cloves (laung / lavang)
 1 bayleaf (tejpatta)
 1 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 2 tsp coriander-cumin seeds (dhania-jeera) powder
 a pinch of asafoetida (hing)
 1 tbsp ghee
 1 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 salt to taste
recipe:
Method
Heat the ghee in a pressure cooker and add the mustard seeds and cumin seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the add curry leaves, green chillies, ginger and garlic, red chillies, cloves and bayleaf and saute for 30 seconds.
Add the vegetables and the remaining ingredients, mix well and add the 1 cup of water.
Add the rice and dal with enough water and cover and pressure cook for 4 whistles.
Allow the steam to escape before opening the lid.
Serve hot with butter milk.
tags:
Gujarati Khichdi 
One Dish Vegetarian Meals
One Meal Dinner
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 30 mins, Total Time: 45 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Easy Moong Dal Khandvi recipe - How to make Easy Moong Dal Khandvi
recipe_ing:
1/2 cup soaked yellow moong dal (split yellow gram)
 1/2 cup curds (dahi)
 1 tsp ginger-green chilli paste
 1/4 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1/4 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 salt to taste
 For The Tempering:
 1 tsp oil
 1 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1 tsp sesame seeds (til)
 1/4 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 For The Garnish:
 2 tbsp coriander (dhania)
recipe:
Method
Drain and blend the moong dal in a mixer to a smooth paste, using 1 tbsp of water.
Combine the moong dal paste, curds, ginger-green chilli paste, turmeric powder, asafoetida and salt in a microwave safe bowl and mix well.
Microwave on high for 7 minutes, stirring in between after every 2 minutes.
Spread the mixture thinly on the back of three 200 mm. (8") diameter thalis and allow to cool for five minutes.
Cut the khandvi into 50 mm. (2") thick strips, carefully rolling up each strip.
How to proceed
For the tempering, heat the oil in a pan and add the mustard seeds.
When they crackle, add the sesame seeds and asafoetida and pour on top of the prepared khandvis.
Serve, garnished with the coriander
tags: Gujarati Farsans
times: Preparation Time: 10 mins, Cooking Time: 10 mins, Total Time: 20 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Sheera recipe - How to make Sheera
recipe_ing:
1 cup semolina (rava)
 1 cup pure ghee
 1 cup sugar
 1 cup milk
 1 cup water
 1 cup raisins (kismis) and almonds (badam)
 1 cup chopped elaichi bananas
 1/2 gm saffron (kesar) strands
 10 gms cardamom (elaichi) powder
recipe:
Fry rawa in ghee on medium flame till it turns reddish.
Boil milk and water and then add to the rawa.
Keep stirring continuously. when the mixture turns semi solid add sugar.
Place a lid and let it cook for two to three minutes on low flame.
Remove and add elaichi powder. dissolve saffron in milk and add to the rawa.
Sprinkle elaichi powde and garnish with kismiss and almonds.
Decorate with pieces of bana
tags:
Gujarati Sweet Mithai
 different kinds of sheera
Diwali
Raksha - Bandhan
Recipes for Weaning (8 to 9 months)
times: Preparation Time: 10, Cooking Time: 10, Total Time: 20 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Alu Vadi (patra) recipe - How to make Alu Vadi (patra)
recipe_ing:
4 colocassia leaves  (arbi ke patte)
 1 cup besan (Bengal gram flour)
 1 tsp chilli powder
 salt to taste
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1/2 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 1 tsp powdered peanuts
 1/2 tsp dried mango powder (amchur)
recipe:
Mix all the ingredients with the besan.
Add required water to make a thick paste.
Take an alu leaf and spread the paste on it.
Place another alu leaf over it and spread the paste on it.
Similarly place all the leaves and then roll it.
Cut the roll into small round pieces.
Either deep fry them or steam them in a pressure cooker.
Temper rai and jeera and pour it over the pieces. serve hot.
tags: Gujarati  Dry Snacks
times: Preparation Time: 20 minutes, Cooking Time: 10 minutes, Total Time: 30 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Gujrati Dal recipe - How to make Gujrati Dal
recipe_ing:
2 cups toovar (arhar) dal
 1 cup chopped yam (suran)
 2 tbsp peanuts
 2 dry dates (kharek) (optional)
 8 pcs  of kokum, soaked
 1 tomato , chopped
 50 gms jaggery (gur)
 1/2 tbsp lemon juice
 1 pc ginger (adrak), chopped
 4 green chillies , slit
 1/2 tsp chilli powder
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1/4 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1/4 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1/4 tsp fenugreek (methi) leaves
 10 to 12 curry leaves (kadi patta)
 2 cloves (laung / lavang)
 2  sticks cinnamon (dalchini)
 1 bayleaf (tejpatta)
 2  small round red chillies (boriya mirchi)
 1/2 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 2 tbsp ghee
 1 tbsp oil
 salt to taste
 4 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
recipe:
Wash and pressure cook the dal in 4 cups of water.
In another vessel, pressure cook the yam, peanuts and kharekh.
When the dal is cooked, cool slightly and blend till it is smooth.
Prepare the tempering by heating the ghee and oil and adding the mustard seeds, cumin seeds, fenugreek seeds, curry leaves, cloves, cinnamon, bay leaf, red chillies and asafoetida.
Add 3 cups of water, the cocum, tomato, jaggery, lemon juice, ginger, green chilli, chilli powder and turmeric powder and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add the dal, yam pieces, peanuts, kharekh and salt and simmer for 10 to 15 minutes.
Serve hot garnished with coriander.
tags:
Collection of Gujarati Dals / Kadhis
 Popular Dals from all over India
times: Preparation Time: 60, Cooking Time: 10, Total Time: 1 hours 10 minutes,

recipe_long_name: Rava Bhakri recipe - How to make Rava Bhakri
recipe_ing:
2  medium sized bowls semolina (rava)
 1  bowl of freshly grated coconut
 1  " piece of ginger (adrak), chopped
 4 green chillies, chopped
 1 tsp sugar
 salt to taste
 ghee to fry
recipe:
Clean rava first.  in a bow take grated cocunut, ginger, chillies, salt, sugar and smash properly, add rava in to it and make a batal of it.
Keep a frying pan  on a flame and greese with ghee and once heated take little mixture and spread on the  pan and fry until golden fry.
Serve hot with chatni or sauce.
tags:
Gujarati Roti, Thepla recipe collection
Jain Rotis, Jain Parathas
Maharashtrian Rotis / Polis
Indian Tawa
times: Cooking Time: 10, Total Time: 10 mins , Preparation Time: 05 mts

recipe_ing:
2 cups toovar (arhar) dal
 1 cup chopped yam (suran)
 2 tbsp peanuts
 2 dry dates (kharek) (optional)
 8 pcs  of kokum, soaked
 1 tomato , chopped
 50 gms jaggery (gur)
 1/2 tbsp lemon juice
 1 pc ginger (adrak), chopped
 4 green chillies , slit
 1/2 tsp chilli powder
 1/2 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1/4 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1/4 tsp cumin seeds (jeera)
 1/4 tsp fenugreek (methi) leaves
 10 to 12 curry leaves (kadi patta)
 2 cloves (laung / lavang)
 2  sticks cinnamon (dalchini)
 1 bayleaf (tejpatta)
 2  small round red chillies (boriya mirchi)
 1/2 tsp asafoetida (hing)
 2 tbsp ghee
 1 tbsp oil
 salt to taste
 4 tbsp chopped coriander (dhania)
recipe:
Wash and pressure cook the dal in 4 cups of water.
In another vessel, pressure cook the yam, peanuts and kharekh.
When the dal is cooked, cool slightly and blend till it is smooth.
Prepare the tempering by heating the ghee and oil and adding the mustard seeds, cumin seeds, fenugreek seeds, curry leaves, cloves, cinnamon, bay leaf, red chillies and asafoetida.
Add 3 cups of water, the cocum, tomato, jaggery, lemon juice, ginger, green chilli, chilli powder and turmeric powder and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add the dal, yam pieces, peanuts, kharekh and salt and simmer for 10 to 15 minutes.
Serve hot garnished with coriander

recipe_name: Green Tandarjo Muthia and Tomato Curry
recipe_long_name: Green Tandarjo Muthia and Tomato Curry recipe - How to make Green Tandarjo Muthia and Tomato Curry
recipe_ing:
For Muthia:
 500 gms chawli (cow pea) leaves
 250 gms fenugreek (methi) leaves
 200 gms whole wheat flour (gehun ka atta)
 1 tsp green chilli paste
 6 tbsp oil
 1 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 1 1/2 tsp chilli powder
 salt to taste
 Tomato curry:
 4 medium sized tomatoes, chopped
 2 tbsp jaggery (gur)
 1 tsp coriander-cumin seeds (dhania-jeera) powder
 1/4 tsp turmeric powder (haldi)
 salt to taste
 1  pinch of asafoetida (hing)
 1 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1 tsp oil
 1 tsp chilli powder
recipe:
Muthia’s (green tandarjo kebabs)
Wash and finely chop tandarjo and methi.
Add flour, oil, salt, green chilli, turmeric powder.
Mix it well, knead to very soft dough.
Add water if required.
Apply some oil in your hands so you can make 2” long cylindrical rolls.
Add water if needed.
Steam for 35-40 minutes in steamer.
Tomato curry
Heat the oil; add asafoetida, mustard seeds, chilli powder and tomatoes.
Stir well.
Add jaggery, salt, dhanjira powder, turmeric powder.
Add water.
Cook at medium heat for 3-4 minutes.
Once the curry is ready dip all the muthia in tomato curry and stir for 2-3 minutes.
Serve steaming muthia with tomato curry.
tags:
Gujarati Farsans
Jain Subzi / Gravies
Sabzis with Gravies
Jain Subzis
Steam
Steamer
times: Preparation Time: 20 minutes, Cooking Time: 40 minutes, Total Time: 1 hours,

recipe_long_name: Sago Chat recipe - How to make Sago Chat
recipe_ing:
1/4 kg sago (sabudana), soaked for 4 hours
 3 to 4 raw banana, mashed
 2 to 3 green chillies
 2 tbsp powdered peanuts
 2 cucumbers, grated
 1 1/2 cups fresh curds (dahi)
 banana chips for garnish
 salt to taste
 1 tsp sugar
 coriander (dhania) for garnish
recipe:
Add sago,banana crushed peanuts green chillies and salt as per taste to make a dough
Can add water if very stiff
Make flat pattice and deep fry these balls .
Add cucumber to the curds add salt and sugar .mix well
Arrange the fried balls in a plate.
Spread the curds over the balls.
Garnish the banana chips over the curds.
Garnish the coriander.serve
tags:
Gujarati  Faral, Faraal
Chaat 
Mahashivaratri
Navratri Vrat
times: Preparation Time: 25 minutes, Cooking Time: 20 minutes, Total Time: 45 mins ,

recipe_long_name: Aam Ras ki Kadhi recipe - How to make Aam Ras ki Kadhi
recipe_ing:
1 cup raw mango pulp
 1 cup ripe mango pulp
 3 tbsp besan (bengal gram flour)
 salt to taste
 1 cup buttermilk
 1 tbsp oil
 a pinch of asafoetida (hing)
 1/2 tsp mustard seeds ( rai / sarson)
 1/4 tsp fenugreek (methi) seeds
 2 slit green chillies
 6 to 8 curry leaves (kadi patta)
 1/2 cup boondi
recipe:
Method
Combine the raw mango pulp, ripe mango pulp, besan, buttermilk and salt in a bowl and whisk well till it turns to a smooth mixture. Keep aside.
Heat the oil in a deep pan, add the asafoetida, mustard seeds and fenugreek seeds and sauté for few seconds.
Add the curry leaves and green chillies and sauté for 2 minutes.
Add mango-buttermilk mixture and little water if required, mix well and bring the kadhi to boil.
Simmer for 10-15 minutes and add the boondi and simmer for 5 more minutes.
Serve hot.
tags:
Collection of Gujarati Dals / Kadhis
Indian Dal and Kadhi
times: Preparation Time: 15 mins, Cooking Time: 30 mins, Total Time: 45 mins ,
